00032 VirtualDirectory::VirtualDirectory(const char *path)
00033 {
00034         db = new DbBackend(path);
00035 }

00037 VirtualDirectory::~VirtualDirectory()
00038 {

00042 int VirtualDirectory::vdir_add_tag(vector <string> *tags, file_info_t *finfo)
00043 {
00044         int res;
00045 
00046         /* bad, bad, bad: accept only the absolute path for a file */
00047         if(finfo->mode & S_IFDIR)
00048                 return -EISDIR;
00049         
00050         res = db->db_add_file_info(tags, finfo);
00051         if(res)
00052                 res = -EINVAL;
00053 
00054         return res;
00055 }

00067 
00068 static int fill_buf(list<string> *tags, void *buf, filler_t filler)
00069 {
00070         for (list<string>::const_iterator i = tags->begin(); i != tags->end(); ++i) {
00071                 if (filler(buf, (*i).c_str(), NULL, 0))
00072                         return 1;
00073         }
00074 
00075         return 0;
00076 }
00077 
00078 int VirtualDirectory::vdir_list_root(void *buf, filler_t filler)
00079 {
00080         list<string> *tags;
00081         int res = 0;
00082         
00083         try {
00084                 /* get all the simple tags */
00085                 tags = db->db_get_tags();
00086                 if(tags == NULL)
00087                         throw std::bad_alloc();
00088                 res = fill_buf(tags, buf, filler);
00089                 tags->clear();
00090                 delete tags;
00091                 if(res)
00092                         return 0;
00093         
00094                 /* and all the tag:value pairs */
00095                 tags = db->db_get_tags_values();
00096                 if(tags == NULL)
00097                         throw std::bad_alloc();
00098         
00099                 res = fill_buf(tags, buf, filler);
00100                 tags->clear();
00101                 delete tags;
00102         }
00103         catch(std::exception) {
00104                 PRINT_ERROR("Hybfs: Not enough memory! %s line %d\n",
00105                                 __func__,__LINE__);
00106                 return -ENOMEM;
00107         }
00108         /* res is the result from our filler*/
00109         
00110         return 0;
00111 }
00112 
00113 int VirtualDirectory::vdir_readdir(const char * query, void *buf,
00114                                    filler_t filler)
00115 {
00116         list<string> *tags;
00117         int res = 0;
00118         PathCrawler *pc;
00119         string path_query;
00120 
00121         /* is this an empty query? */
00122         if (query[0] == '\0') {
00123                 PRINT_ERROR("NULL query; use readroot instead! \n");
00124                 return -EINVAL;
00125         }
00126 
00127         tags = new list<string>;
00128         
00129         /* get all the queries that are relative to this one in a queue */
00130         pc = new PathCrawler(query);
00131         if(pc == NULL) {
00132                 delete tags;
00133                 
00134                 return -ENOMEM;
00135         }
00136         
00137         pc->break_queries();
00138         /* TODO : here I should rebuild the query, so that '/' becomes + ? 
00139          * um, and use the parser so that we can support complex queries */
00140         res = 0;
00141         while(pc->has_next_query()) {
00142                 string to_query = pc->pop_next_query();
00143                 if(to_query.find(REAL_DIR) == 1) {
00144                         path_query = to_query;
00145                         continue;
00146                 }
00147                 /* strip the '(' and ')' */
00148                 try {
00149                         to_query.erase(0,1);
00150                         to_query.erase(to_query.length() -1);
00151                 }
00152                 catch(std::exception) {
00153                         DBG_PRINT("Weird exception at parsing string %s\n", 
00154                                         to_query.c_str());
00155                         res = -1;
00156                         break;
00157                 }
00158                 tags->push_back(to_query);
00159         }
00160         /* now I have the tag:value packed in a list, get us some results.
00161          * Fill directly the buffer using the provided filler method */
00162         if(res == 0)
00163                 res = db->db_get_filesinfo(tags, &path_query, buf, filler);
00164         
00165         tags->clear();
00166         delete tags;
00167         delete pc;
00168         
00169         return (res == -1) ? -EIO : 0;
00170 }
